You might not of heard of carbon footprint...It means divide the total distance travelled over life of boat by the CO2 released in its manufacture...Same is done for cars....It has a diesel engine which would add to the carbon footprint however it won't be used on this trip...

Am still trying to work out what point you are http://making.Is  it that you are wealthy enough to afford a winter holiday,or carbon footprint doesn’t concern you or that climate disaster activists get up your nose or maybe it’s all three.?Very asinine in any event.

Lets do a more simple example an electric car...Let's say the car is zero emissions like the boat crossing the Atlantic..Making the car and battery releases CO2 same an making a boat from man made materials..Divide this by distance travelled over lifetime of car carbon footprint

CO2 is released in manufacturing process of a racing Yacht same as in a performance F1 car..Fibre glass...carbon fibre hull and mad made sail all release CO2 in their manufacture..Boat is all man made.Have to divide this figure by lifetime distance same as carbon footprint of car

However in any carbon footprint calculation also have to take into account carbon used in manufacturing process...Average it over lifetime of craft....Most of the materials in racing craft and mad made materials using carbon from oil....
